title: After Nepal, Pakistan Releases New Coin To Commemorate 550th Anniversary Of Guru Nanak Dev
text:
After Nepal, Pakistan Releases New Coin To Commemorate 550th Anniversary Of Guru Nanak Dev

After Nepal, Pakistan Releases New Coin To Commemorate 550th Anniversary Of Guru Nanak Dev

The government of Pakistan has released a new coin in order to commemorate the 550th anniversary of Baba Guru Nanak. The coin worth Pakistan Rupees 50 will be available at the Kartarpur Sahib along with a postal stamp worth PKR 8 to the travelling pilgrims, news agency ANI reported, quoting Dunya News.

Meanwhile, India on Tuesday shared a list of 575 pilgrims scheduled to attend the inaugural 'jatha' to Gurudwara Kartarpur Sahib through the Kartarpur corridor in Pakistan.

An Indian Border Security Force (BSF) soldier stands guard at a newly built road for Indian Sikh pilgrims at the under construction Kartarpur Corridor in Dera Baba Nanak. AP PHOTO

The first group of pilgrims from India is expected to depart for the neighbouring country on November 9.

India had, on October 24, signed an agreement with Pakistan on the modalities for operationalising Kartarpur Sahib corridor, paving the way for its inauguration ahead of the birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev.

Islamabad will levy $20 as a service charge on each Indian, who will visit Gurdwara Darbar Sahib, the shrine of Guru Nanak Dev in Pakistan.

The corridor connects Dera Baba Nanak shrine in Gurdaspur in India to Darbar Sahib Gurdwara in Kartarpur, Pakistan.

Earlier, India’s neighbouring country Nepal had also launched three commemorative coins to mark the 550th birth anniversary of Guru Nanak, who is said to have visited Balaju area in the outskirt of Kathmandu five hundred years ago.

IndiaInNepal On Twitter

This step by the country that has over 81 per cent Hindus in its population is being looked at and hailed as an attempt to revive its Sikh connect and send a larger message of endurance for all communities and countries throughout the globe.

In the meanwhile, India’s national carrier Air India has also decided to install a special symbol on its aircraft that will fly between Amritsar and London to mark the 550th birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev.

In a first gesture of its kind by an Indian airline, the symbol of “Ek Onkar” will be painted on the plane’s tail while the fuselage will be marked with the words ‘Shri Guru Nanak Dev ji 550 Years Celebrations’.
